page.title: 01GAZETEER OF THE AREA
page.content: The block comprises most of the parish of Overton,Middleton,and some of Sunderland Point.The villages of Overton and Middleton can be found in the North-West corner of Lancashire, 3 miles south of the city of Lancaster, near the resort town of Morecambe. The small settlement at Sunderland Point,lies 2 miles south of Overton,and is accessible only at low tide. The area is dominated by the salt- marshes of the Lune Estuary.The villages are very low-lying,and rural in character.Overton and Middleton were mentioned in the original Domesday survey.OvertonÂ£s chapel dates from Anglo-Saxon times-it is the oldest church in Lancashire.Many of the present families can trace their descent back for 300 years or so.
